member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.UploadInfo
member.summary: Represents file which is uploading - its file size, uploaded bytes, filename, etc.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.UploadInfo.AdditionalDataFields
member.summary: Gets the additional data fields that could be submitted while uploading the file. It returns dictionary which has as a key - the name of the submitted data field and as a value - the value of the data field If the browser supports HTML5 file API - like latest versions of Chrome, Mozilla FF, IE - data fields(like username) are added to the FormData object which is sent to the server via XMLHttpRequest object If the browser does NOT support HTML5 file API - like older versions of IE - IE10 and earlier - then these values are added as hidden fields to the form(that contains uploading file and is submitted to the server) These fields are inside the header of the http request

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel
member.summary: QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel defines the four level of Reed-Solomon error correction for the QR Code symbol.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Low
member.summary: Low error correction level allows recovery of 7% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Medium
member.summary: Medium error correction level allows recovery of 15% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.Quartil
member.summary: Quartil error correction level allows recovery of 25% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeErrorCorrectionLevel.High
member.summary: High error correction level allows recovery of 30% of the symbol codewords.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode
member.summary: Specifies the encoding mode for compacting the data for the QR Code symbol. The modes are based on the character values and assignments associated with the default ECI (ECI 000003 representing the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode.Undefined
member.summary: When Undefined encoding mode is set, the QR code barcode internally switches between modes as necessary in order to achieve the most efficient conversion of data into a binary string.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode.Numeric
member.summary: Numeric mode encodes data from decimal digit set (0-9). Normally 3 data characters are represented by 10 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode.Alphanumeric
member.summary: Alphanumerc mode encodes data from a set of 45 characters (digits 0-9, upper case letters A-Z, nine other characters: space, $ % * + _ . / : ). Normally two input characters are represented by 11 bits.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode.Byte
member.summary: In Byte mode the data is encoded at 8 bits per character. The character set of the Byte encoding mode is byte data (by default it is ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode.Kanji
member.summary: The Kanji mode efficiently encodes Kanji characters in accordance with the Shift JIS system based on JIS X 0208. Each two-byte character value is compactedd to a 13-bit binary codeword.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Fnc1Mode
member.summary: Fnc1Mode indicator is used for messages containing specific data formats. Fnc1Mode applies to the entire symbol and is not affected by subsequent mode indicators.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Fnc1Mode.None
member.summary: Do not use any Fnc1 symbols, i.e. the data is not identified according to specific predefined industry or application specifications.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Fnc1Mode.Gs1
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the first position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordance with the GS1 General Specification.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Fnc1Mode.Industry
member.summary: Uses Fnc1 symbol in the second position of the character in Code 128 symbols and designates data formatted in accordane with a specific indystry application previously agreed with AIM Inc.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Stretch
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that describes how an Image should be stretched to fill the destination rectangle.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Stretch.None
member.summary: The content preserves its original size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Stretch.Fill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions. The aspect ratio is not preserved.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Stretch.Uniform
member.summary: The content is resized to fit in the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Stretch.UniformToFill
member.summary: The content is resized to fill the destination dimensions while it preserves its native aspect ratio. If the aspect ratio of the destination rectangle differs from the source, the source content is clipped to fit in the destination dimensions.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BarcodeClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by the barcode

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BarcodeClientEvents.ErrorMessageDisplaying
member.summary:
Event which is raised when an error has happened.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to barcode widget.
Use ui.errorMessage to obtain the error message.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BarcodeClientEvents.DataChanged
member.summary:
Event which is raised when the data has changed.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to barcode widget.
Use ui.newData to obtain the new data.

members.member:
Helper to configure a Combo widget for name and data source.
ID of control and name of field. If that is evaluated IEnumerable<SelectListItem>, then it is used to set SelectedValues to string. If is evaluated to IEnumerable, then it is used to set DataSource. Setter for DataSource of ComboWrapper New instance of ComboWrapper Old

member.summary: Sets the error correction level of the QR Code symbol.

member.summary: Sets the size version of the QR Code symbol.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeBarcode`1.EncodingMode(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.EncodingMode)
member.summary: Sets the encoding mode for compaction of the QR Code symbol data. The default value is undefined if the Shift_JIS encoding is loaded. Otherwise the default value is byte.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeBarcode`1.EciNumber(System.Int32)
member.summary: Each Extended Channel Interpretation (ECI) is designated by a six-digit assignment number: 000000 - 999999. The default value depends on the loaded encodings. The default is ECI 000003 (representing ISO/IEC 8859-1) if the ISO/IEC 8859-1 character set is loaded. Otherwise the default value is 000026 (representing UTF-8).

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeBarcode`1.EciHeaderDisplayMode(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HeaderDisplayMode)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether to show the ECI header.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeBarcode`1.Fnc1Mode(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.Fnc1Mode)
member.summary: Sets the FNC1 mode indicator which identifies symbols encoding messages formatted according to specific predefined industry or application specifications.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.QRCodeBarcode`1.ApplicationIndicator(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the Application Indicator assigned to identify the specification concerned by AIM International. The value is respected only when the Fnc1Mode is set to Industry. Its value may take the form of any single Latin alphabetic character from the set {a - z, A - Z} or a two-digit number.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BulletGraphClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by BulletGraph (igBulletGraph widget)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BulletGraphClientEvents.FormatLabel
member.summary:
Event which is raised when a label of the bullet graph is formatted.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to bullet graph widget.
Use ui.actualMinimumValue to obtain the mimimum value of bullet graph scale.
Use ui.actualMaximumValue to obtain the maximum value of bullet graph scale.
Use ui.value to obtain the value on the bullet graph scale associated with the label.
Use ui.label to obtain the string value of the label.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BulletGraphClientEvents.AlignLabel
member.summary:
Event which is raised when a label of the bullet graph is aligned along the scale.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to bullet graph widget.
Use ui.actualMinimumValue to obtain the mimimum value of bullet graph scale.
Use ui.actualMaximumValue to obtain the maximum value of bullet graph scale.
Use ui.value to obtain the value on the bullet graph scale associated with the label.
Use ui.label to obtain the string value of the label. Use ui.width to obtain the width of the label.
Use ui.height to obtain the height of the label.
Use ui.offsetX to obtain the X offset of the label on the bullet graph scale.
Use ui.offsetY to obtain the Y offset of the label on the bullet graph scale.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ConsolidatedItemHitTestBehavior

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ConsolidatedItemHitTestBehavior.Basic
member.summary: Returns the item based on the X-location only. Will return one of the consolidated items.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ConsolidatedItemHitTestBehavior.NearestY

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleStartExtent(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the extent (from -1 to 1) at which to start rendering the needle, measured from the center of the gauge. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleEndExtent(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the extent (from -1 to 1) at which to end rendering the needle, measured from the center of the gauge. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleShape(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGaugeNeedleShape)
member.summary: Sets the shape to use when rendering the needle from a number of options.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleStartWidthRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width of the needle at its point using a value from (0 to 1). Note: Only some needle shapes respect this property. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleEndWidthRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width of the needle at its point using a value from (0 to 1). Note: Only some needle shapes respect this property. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleBaseFeatureWidthRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width of the needle at its feature which is closest to the base (e.g. a bulb) with a value from 0 to 1. Note: Only some needle shapes respect this property, namely: NeedleWithBulb, RectangleWithBulb, TrapezoidWithBulb, and TriangleWithBulb. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedleBaseFeatureExtent(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the extent of the feature which is closest to the base (e.g. a bulb) with a value from -1 to 1. Note: Only some needle shapes respect this property, namely: NeedleWithBulb, RectangleWithBulb, TrapezoidWithBulb, and TriangleWithBulb. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedlePointFeatureWidthRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width of the needle at its feature which is closest to the point (e.g. the tapering point of a needle) with a value from 0 to 1. Note: Only some needle shapes respect this property. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedlePointFeatureExtent(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the extent of the feature which is closest to the point (e.g. the tapering point of a needle) with a value from -1 to 1. Note: Only some needle shapes respect this property. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedlePivotWidthRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width of the cap of the needle with a value from 0 to 1. Note: Will only take effect if you have a cap set on the needle. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedlePivotInnerWidthRatio(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the width of the inner cutout section of the needle cap with a value from 0 to 1. Note: Will only take effect if you have a cap set on the needle that has a cutout section.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedlePivotShape(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGaugePivotShape)
member.summary: Sets the shape to use for the needle cap.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.ScaleStartExtent(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the position at which to start rendering the scale, measured from the center of the gauge as a value from 0 to 1. Values further from zero than 1 can be used to make this extend further than the normal radius of the gauge.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.NeedlePivotBrush(System.String)
member.summary: Sets the brush to use for filling the needle cap. Note: this only applies to certain cap shapes.

member.summary: Sets the brush to use for filling the needle cap. Note: this only applies to certain cap shapes.

member.summary: Sets the brush to use for the outlines of the needle cap.

member.summary: Sets the brush to use for the outlines of the needle cap.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.RadialGauge`1.RadiusMultiplier(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the multiplying factor to apply to the normal radius of the gauge. The radius of the gauge is defined by the minimum of the width and height of the control divided by 2.0. This introduces a multiplicative factor to that value.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChart`3.UnknownValuePlotting(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.UnknownValuePlotting)
member.summary: Sets the behavior that determines how unknown values will be plotted on the chart.
member.remarks: Null and Double.NaN are two examples of unknown values.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChart`3.Resolution(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the rendering resolution for all series in this chart.
member.remarks: Where n = Resolution, for every n horizontal pixels, combine all items into a single datapoint. When Resolution = 0, all datapoints will be rendered as graphical objects. Charts with a higher resolution will have faster performance.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChart`3.Thickness(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the thickness for all series in this chart. Depending on the ChartType, this can be the main brush used, or just the outline.

member.summary: Sets the maximum number of markers displyed in the plot area of the chart.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChart`3.TrendLineType(Infragistics.Web.Mvc.TrendLineType)
member.summary: Sets the formula used for calculating trend lines in this chart.
member.remarks: This property applies only to these chart types: point, line, spline, and bubble

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChart`3.TrendLineThickness(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the thickness of the trend lines in this chart.
member.remarks: This property applies only to these chart types: point, line, spline, and bubble

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChart`3.AlignsGridLinesToPixels(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets a value indicating whether grid and tick lines are aligned to device pixels.
member.value: true if grid and tick lines are aligned to device pixels; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.XAxisInterval(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the frequency of displayed labels along the X-axis.
member.remarks: Sets the set value is a factor that determines which labels will be hidden. For example, an interval of 2 will display every other label.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.XAxisMinorInterval(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the frequency of displayed minor lines along the X-axis.
member.remarks: Sets the set value is a factor that determines how the minor lines will be displayed.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.XAxisGap(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the amount of space between adjacent categories for the X-axis.
member.remarks: The gap is silently clamped to the range [0, 1] when used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.XAxisOverlap(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the amount of overlap between adjacent categories for the X-axis.
member.remarks: Sets the overlap is silently clamped to the range [-1, 1] when used.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.YAxisInterval(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the distance between each label and grid line along the Y-axis.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.YAxisIsLogarithmic(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Sets whether the Y-axis should use a logarithmic scale instead of a linear one.
member.remarks: Since log(-1) is imaginary and log(0) is undefined, it is recommended to enable this property only when the Y-axis minimum is greater than zero.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.YAxisLogarithmBase(System.Int32)
member.summary: Sets the base value to use in the log function when mapping the position of data items along the Y-axis.
member.remarks: This property is effective only when YAxisIsLogarithmic is true.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChart`1.YAxisMinimumValue(System.Double)
member.summary: Sets the data value corresponding to the minimum value of the Y-axis.

member.summary: Sets the data value corresponding to the maximum value of the Y-axis.

member.summary: Sets the frequency of displayed minor lines along the Y-axis.

member.summary: Sets whether the large numbers on the Y-axis labels are abbreviated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.UnknownValuePlotting
member.summary: Gets or sets the behavior that determines how unknown values will be plotted on the chart.
member.remarks: Null and Double.NaN are two examples of unknown values.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.Resolution
member.summary: Gets or sets the rendering resolution for all series in this chart.
member.remarks: Where n = Resolution, for every n horizontal pixels, combine all items into a single datapoint. When Resolution = 0, all datapoints will be rendered as graphical objects. Charts with a higher resolution will have faster performance.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.Thickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness for all series in this chart. Depending on the ChartType, this can be the main brush used, or just the outline.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.MarkerMaxCount
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of markers displyed in the plot area of the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.TrendLineType
member.summary: Gets or sets the formula used for calculating trend lines in this chart.
member.remarks: This property applies only to these chart types: point, line, spline, and bubble

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.TrendLineThickness
member.summary: Gets or sets the thickness of the trend lines in this chart.
member.remarks: This property applies only to these chart types: point, line, spline, and bubble

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DomainChartModel.AlignsGridLinesToPixels

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.FormatLabel
member.summary:
Sets or gets a function which takes an object that produces a formatted label for displaying in the chart.
Function should return string and it takes 1 parameter: original value of label.
Example:
"function(val) { return typeof val === 'number' && val < 0 ? '(' + (-val) + ')' : val; }"

member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency of displayed labels along the X-axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.XAxisMinorInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the frequency of displayed minor lines along the X-axis.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the set value is a factor that determines how the minor lines will be displayed.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.XAxisGap
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of space between adjacent categories for the X-axis.
member.remarks: The gap is silently clamped to the range [0, 1] when used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.XAxisOverlap
member.summary: Gets or sets the amount of overlap between adjacent categories for the X-axis.
member.remarks: Gets or sets the overlap is silently clamped to the range [-1, 1] when used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.YAxisInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets the distance between each label and grid line along the Y-axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.YAxisIsLogarithmic
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the Y-axis should use a logarithmic scale instead of a linear one.
member.remarks: Since log(-1) is imaginary and log(0) is undefined, it is recommended to enable this property only when the Y-axis minimum is greater than zero.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.CategoryChartModel.YAxisLogarithmBase
member.summary: Gets or sets the base value to use in the log function when mapping the position of data items along the Y-axis.
member.remarks: This property is effective only when YAxisIsLogarithmic is true.

member.summary: The minimum scale at which this series becomes visible.
member.remarks: The default value for this property is 1.0, which means the series will always be visible. At a VisibleFromScale setting of 0.0, the series will never be visible. At a VisibleFromScale setting of 0.5, the series will be visible as long as the map is zoomed in to at least 200%.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GeographicShapeSeriesBase`3.ShapeMemberPath(System.String)
member.summary: The name of the property on ItemsSource items which, for each shape, contains a list of points to be converted to a polygon.
member.remarks: To be consistent with the Shapefile technical description, it is expected that each list of points is defined as an IEnumerable of IEnumerable of Point, or in other words, a list of lists of points.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GeographicShapeSeriesBase`3.ShapeFilterResolution(System.Double)
member.summary: The resolution at which to filter out shapes in the series. For example, if the ShapeFilterResolution is set to 3, then elements with a bounding rectangle smaller than 3 X 3 pixels will be filtered out.
member.remarks: In the case of GeographicPolylineSeries, the resolution is compared to either dimension, rather than both. In other words, a polyline will not be filtered if its height or its width exceeds the value of this property. Whereas with a ShapeSeries, both the height and the width must exceed the value of this property.

member.summary: class describing geographic shape series base object.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GeographicShapeSeriesBaseModel.ShapeMemberPath
member.summary: The name of the property on ItemsSource items which, for each shape, contains a list of points to be converted to a polygon.
member.remarks: To be consistent with the Shapefile technical description, it is expected that each list of points is defined as an IEnumerable of IEnumerable of Point, or in other words, a list of lists of points.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GeographicShapeSeriesBaseModel.ShapeFilterResolution
member.summary: The resolution at which to filter out shapes in the series. For example, if the ShapeFilterResolution is set to 3, then elements with a bounding rectangle smaller than 3 X 3 pixels will be filtered out.
member.remarks: In the case of GeographicPolylineSeries, the resolution is compared to either dimension, rather than both. In other words, a polyline will not be filtered if its height or its width exceeds the value of this property. Whereas with a ShapeSeries, both the height and the width must exceed the value of this property.

member.summary: Sets gets if smoother scrolling with small intertia should be used when using mouse wheel.

member.summary: Sets or gets the modifier for how many pixels will be scrolled when using the mouse wheel once. This is used only for the smooth scrolling behavior.

member.summary: Sets or gets the modifier for how long the scroll ‘animation’ lasts when using the mouse wheel once. This is used only for the smooth scrolling behavior.

member.summary: Sets gets the modifier for how much the inertia scrolls on mobile devices.

member.summary: Sets gets the modifier for how long the inertia last on mobile devices.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel
member.summary: Class describing base options available for the igEditors.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.ID
member.summary: Sets the ID of the editor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.InputName
member.summary:
Sets the name of the HTML input used to store and submit the editor value. Optional.
Will override the existing name attribute if intialized on an input.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.Width
member.summary:
Sets initial width of editor.
Number and valid html size-units can be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.Height
member.summary:
Sets initial height of editor.
Number and valid html size-units can be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.Value
member.summary: Gets sets value in editor. The effect of setting/getting that option depends on type of editor and on dataMode options. That can be string, number or Date depending on type of editor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.TabIndex
member.summary: Gets sets value in tabIndex for editor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.AllowNullValue
member.summary: Sets gets ability to prevent null value. If that option is false, and editor has no value, then value is set to an empty string.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.NullValue
member.summary: Sets gets the representation of null value. Can be either string or numeric. Default is null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.BaseEditorModel.ReadOnly
member.summary:

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions
member.summary: Options applied to the date editor calendar, using jQuery datepicker API.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.DefaultDate
member.summary: Set the date to highlight on first opening if the field is blank. Relative date that contains value and period pairs; valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.MinDate
member.summary: The minimum selectable date. Relative date that contains value and period pairs; valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.MaxDate
member.summary: The maximum selectable date. Relative date that contains value and period pairs; valid periods are "y" for years, "m" for months, "w" for weeks, and "d" for days. For example, "+1m +7d" represents one month and seven days from today.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.FirstDay
member.summary: Set the first day of the week using the following days enumeration.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowWeek
member.summary: When true, a column is added to show the week of the year. If the calculateWeek handler is defined, it determines how the week of the year is calculated.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.WeekHeader
member.summary: The text to display for the week of the year column heading. Use the showWeek option to display this column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.DayNamesMin
member.summary: The list of minimised day names, starting from Sunday, for use as column headers within the datepicker.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowOtherMonths
member.summary: Whether to display dates in other months (non-selectable) at the start or end of the current month. To make these days selectable use the SelectOtherMonths option.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.SelectOtherMonths
member.summary: Whether days in other months shown before or after the current month are selectable. This only applies if the ShowOtherMonths option is set to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.HideIfNoPrevNext
member.summary: Normally the previous and next links are disabled when not applicable. You can hide them altogether by setting this attribute to true.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.PrevText
member.summary: The text to display for the previous month link. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.NextText
member.summary: The text to display for the next month link. With the standard ThemeRoller styling, this value is replaced by an icon.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.NumberOfMonths
member.summary: The number of months to show at once.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.StepMonths
member.summary: Set how many months to move when clicking the previous/next links.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowCurrentAtPos
member.summary: When displaying multiple months via the NumberOfMonths option, the showCurrentAtPos option defines which position to display the current month in.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ChangeMonth
member.summary: Whether the month should be rendered as a dropdown instead of text.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.MonthNamesShort
member.summary: The list of abbreviated month names, as used in the month header on each datepicker.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ChangeYear
member.summary: Whether the year should be rendered as a dropdown instead of text. Use the YearRange option to control which years are made available for selection.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.YearRange
member.summary: The range of years displayed in the year drop-down: either relative to today's year ("-nn:+nn"), relative to the currently selected year ("c-nn:c+nn"), absolute ("nnnn:nnnn"), or combinations of these formats ("nnnn:-nn"). Note that this option only affects what appears in the drop-down, to restrict which dates may be selected use the MinDate and/or MaxDate options.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.YearSuffix
member.summary: Additional text to display after the year in the month headers.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowMonthAfterYear
member.summary: Whether to show the month after the year in the header.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowButtonPanel
member.summary: Whether to display a button pane underneath the calendar. The button pane contains two buttons, a Today button that links to the current day, and a Done button that closes the datepicker. The buttons' text can be customized using the CurrentText and CloseText options respectively.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.GoToCurrent
member.summary: When true, the current day link moves to the currently selected date instead of today.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.CurrentText
member.summary: The text to display for the current day link. Use the ShowButtonPanel option to display this button.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.CloseText
member.summary: The text to display for the close link. Use the ShowButtonPanel option to display this button.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowAnim
member.summary: The name of the animation used to show and hide the datepicker. Use one of the following animation effects.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.ShowOptions
member.summary: Additional properties for the provided animation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DatePickerOptions.IsRTL
member.summary: Whether the current language is drawn from right to left.

member.summary: Names of client events exposed by Hierarchical Grid Framework (igHierarchicalGrid widget)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HierarchicalGridClientEvents.RowExpanding
member.summary: Event which is fired when a hierarchical row is about to be expanded. Return false in order to cancel row expanding. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to access the hierarchical grid object. Use ui.parentrow to access the row element for the row that's about to be expanded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HierarchicalGridClientEvents.RowExpanded
member.summary: Event which is fired after a hierarchical row has been expanded. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to access the hierarchical grid object. Use ui.parentrow to access the row element for the row that was expanded.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HierarchicalGridClientEvents.RowCollapsing
member.summary: Event which is fired when a hierarchical row is about to be collapsed. Return false in order to cancel row collapsing. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to access the hierarchical grid object. Use ui.parentrow to access the row element for the row that's about to be collapsed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HierarchicalGridClientEvents.RowCollapsed
member.summary: Event which is fired when a hierarchical row has been collapsed. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to access the hierarchical grid object. Use ui.parentrow to access the row element for the row that was collapsed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HierarchicalGridClientEvents.ChildrenPopulating
member.summary: Event which is fired when children are about to be populated (Load on demand). Return false in order to cancel children populating. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to access the hierarchical grid object. Use ui.parentrow to access the row element for the row that's about to be populated. Use ui.id to get the data ID of the row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.HierarchicalGridClientEvents.ChildrenPopulated
member.summary: Event which is fired when children have been populated (Load on demand). Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to access the hierarchical grid object. Use ui.parentrow to access the row element for the row that was populated. Use ui.id to get the data ID of the row.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridAppendRowsOnDemandClientEvents.RowsRequesting
member.summary: Event fired before the rows are requested from the remote endpoint. Return false in order to cancel requesting of rows. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get reference to igGridAppendRowsOnDemand. Use ui.owner.grid to get reference to igGrid. Use ui.chunkIndex to get next chunk index. Use ui.chunkSize to get next chunk size.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridAppendRowsOnDemandClientEvents.RowsRequested
member.summary: Event fired after the requested rows are returned from the remote endpoint, but before grid data rebinds. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get reference to igGridAppendRowsOnDemand. Use ui.owner.grid to get reference to igGrid. Use ui.chunkIndex to get current chunk index. Use ui.chunkSize to get chunk size. Use ui.rows to get requested rows.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridMultiColumnHeadersClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by Grid Multi-column Headers (igGridMultiColumnHeaders widget)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridMultiColumnHeadersClientEvents.GroupCollapsing
member.summary: Event fired before a group collapsing operation is executed. The handler function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridMultiColumnHeaders widget. Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget. Use ui.column to get the column object for the current group that is collapsing. Use ui.element to get a reference to the jQuery object for the column being collapsing (th).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridMultiColumnHeadersClientEvents.GroupCollapsed
member.summary: Event fired after the group collapsing has been executed and results are rendered. The handler function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridMultiColumnHeaders widget. Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget. Use ui.column to get the column object for the current group that is collapsed. Use ui.element to get a reference to the jQuery object for the column being collapsed (th).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridMultiColumnHeadersClientEvents.GroupExpanding
member.summary: Event fired before a group expanding operation is executed. The handler function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridMultiColumnHeaders widget. Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget. Use ui.column to get the column object for the current group that is expanding. Use ui.element to get a reference to the jQuery object for the column being expanded (th).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.GridMultiColumnHeadersClientEvents.GroupExpanded
member.summary: Event fired after the group expanding has been executed and results are rendered. The handler function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get the reference to the igGridMultiColumnHeaders widget. Use ui.owner.grid to get the reference to the igGrid widget. Use ui.column to get the column object for the current group that is expanded. Use ui.element to get a reference to the jQuery object for the column being expanded (th).

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LinearGaugeClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by LinearGauge (igLinearGauge widget)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LinearGaugeClientEvents.FormatLabel
member.summary:
Event which is raised when a label of the linear gauge is formatted.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to linear gauge widget.
Use ui.actualMinimumValue to obtain the mimimum value of linear gauge scale.
Use ui.actualMaximumValue to obtain the maximum value of linear gauge scale.
Use ui.value to obtain the value on the linear gauge scale associated with the label.
Use ui.label to obtain the string value of the label.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LinearGaugeClientEvents.AlignLabel
member.summary:
Event which is raised when a label of the linear gauge is aligned along the scale.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to linear gauge widget.
Use ui.actualMinimumValue to obtain the mimimum value of linear gauge scale.
Use ui.actualMaximumValue to obtain the maximum value of linear gauge scale.
Use ui.value to obtain the value on the linear gauge scale associated with the label.
Use ui.label to obtain the string value of the label. Use ui.width to obtain the width of the label.
Use ui.height to obtain the height of the label.
Use ui.offsetX to obtain the X offset of the label on the linear gauge scale.
Use ui.offsetY to obtain the Y offset of the label on the linear gauge scale.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel
member.summary: class describing series viewer object.
Stores configuration information for a SeriesViewer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.AnimateSeriesWhenAxisRangeChanges
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series animations should be allowed when a range change has been detected on an axis.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.UseTiledZooming
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series viewer should use cached tiles during zooms rather than the default live content.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.PreferHigherResolutionTiles
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series viewer should prefer selecting higher resolution tiles over lower resolution tiles when performing tile zooming. Setting this to true will lower performance but increase quality.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.ZoomTileCacheSize
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum number of zoom tiles that the series viewer should cache while in tiled zooming mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.HighlightingTransitionDuration
member.summary:
Gets or sets the duration the highlighting/de-highlighting effects.
This is a dependency property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.IsPagePanningAllowed
member.summary: Gets or sets the whether the series viewer can allow the page to pan if a control pan is not possible in the requested direction.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.ContentHitTestMode
member.summary: Determines the method of hit testing used when mousing over elements in the chart.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.IsSurfaceInteractionDisabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether all surface interactions with the plot area should be disabled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.WindowResponse
member.summary: The response to user panning and zooming: whether to update the view immediately while the user action is happening, or to defer the update to after the user action is complete. The user action will be an action such as a mouse drag which causes panning and/or zooming to occur.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.WindowRectMinWidth
member.summary: Sets or gets the minimum width that the window rect is allowed to reach before being clamped. Decrease this value if you want to allow for further zooming into the viewer. If this value is lowered too much it can cause graphical corruption due to floating point arithmetic inaccuracy.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.SyncChannel
member.summary: Sets or gets the Synchronization channel to use for the SeriesViewer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.OverviewPlusDetailPaneVisibility
member.summary: The visibility of the OverviewPlusDetailPane.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.CrosshairVisibility
member.summary: Gets or sets the current SeriesViewer's crosshair visibility override.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.IsDragCrosshairEnabled
member.summary: Gets or sets whether the drag crosshair is enabled. Please note that it is automatically enabled if the crosshairs are set to visible.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.SeriesViewerModel.PlotAreaBackground
member.summary: Gets or sets the brush used as the background for the current SeriesViewer object's plot area.

member.summary: The style of the end point of any lines or polylines representing this series.
member.remarks: Not every series type has a line at which it would be appropriate to display an end cap, so this property does not affect every series type. LineSeries, for example, is affected by EndCap, but ColumnSeries is not.

member.summary: Gets or sets whether the series receives mouse events.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LegendClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by Legend

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LegendClientEvents.LegendItemMouseLeftButtonDown
member.summary:
Occurs when the left mouse button is pressed while the mouse pointer is over an element of this legend.
Function takes arguments evt and ui.
Use ui.legend to get reference to current legend object.
Use ui.chart to get reference to chart owner object.
Use ui.series to get reference to current series owner object.
Use ui.actualItemBrush to get legend item brush.Use ui.actualSeriesBrush to get series owner brush.
Use ui.item to get reference to chart item related to event.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LegendClientEvents.LegendItemMouseLeftButtonUp
member.summary:
Occurs when the left mouse button is released while the mouse pointer is over an element of this legend.
Function takes arguments evt and ui.
Use ui.legend to get reference to current legend object.
Use ui.chart to get reference to chart owner object.
Use ui.series to get reference to current series owner object.
Use ui.actualItemBrush to get legend item brush.Use ui.actualSeriesBrush to get series owner brush.
Use ui.item to get reference to chart item related to event.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LegendClientEvents.LegendItemMouseEnter
member.summary:
Occurs when the left mouse pointer enters an element of this legend.
Function takes arguments evt and ui.
Use ui.legend to get reference to current legend object.
Use ui.chart to get reference to chart owner object.
Use ui.series to get reference to current series owner object.
Use ui.actualItemBrush to get legend item brush.Use ui.actualSeriesBrush to get series owner brush.
Use ui.item to get reference to chart item related to event.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.LegendClientEvents.LegendItemMouseLeave
member.summary:
Occurs when the left mouse pointer leaves an element of this legend.
Function takes arguments evt and ui.
Use ui.legend to get reference to current legend object.
Use ui.chart to get reference to chart owner object.
Use ui.series to get reference to current series owner object.
Use ui.actualItemBrush to get legend item brush.Use ui.actualSeriesBrush to get series owner brush.
Use ui.item to get reference to chart item related to event.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by Combo (igCombo widget)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.Rendered
member.summary: Event which is raised after rendering of the combo completes. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get a reference to the combo performing rendering. Use ui.element to get a reference to the main/top combo element.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.DataBinding
member.summary:
Event which is raised before data binding.
Function takes first argument null and second argument ui.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo.
Use ui.dataSource to obtain reference to instance of $.ig.DataSource used by combo.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.DataBound
member.summary: Event which is raised after data binding is complete. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo performing the data binding. Use ui.dataView to get a reference to the data igCombo is databound to. Use ui.success to see if the databinding was performed correctly. Use ui.errorMessage to get the error message if the databinding failed.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.Filtering
member.summary: Event which is raised before data filtering. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. That can be null. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.expression to obtain reference to array which contains expressions supported by $.ig.DataSource. Each expression-item contains following members: fieldName (textKey), cond (filteringCondition), expr (value/string to filter).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.Filtered
member.summary: Event which is raised after filtering. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. That can be null. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.expression to obtain reference to array which contains expressions supported by $.ig.DataSource. Each expression-item contains following members: fieldName (textKey), cond (filteringCondition), expr (value/string to filter).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.ItemsRendering
member.summary: Event which is raised before rendering of the combo items is performed. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get a reference to the combo performing rendering.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.ItemsRendered
member.summary: Event which is raised after rendering of the combo items completes. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use ui.owner to get a reference to the combo performing rendering. Use ui.items to get a reference to the items rendered.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.DropDownOpening
member.summary: Event which is raised before drop-down list is opened. Return false in order to cancel drop-down action. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.element to obtain reference to jquery DOM element which represents container of list.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.DropDownOpened
member.summary: Event which is raised after drop-down list was opened. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.element to obtain reference to jquery DOM element which represents container of list.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.DropDownClosing
member.summary: Event which is raised before drop-down list is closed. Return false in order to cancel hide action. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.element to obtain reference to jquery DOM element which represents container of list.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.DropDownClosed
member.summary: Event which is raised after drop-down list was closed. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.element to obtain reference to jquery DOM element which represents container of list.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.SelectionChanging
member.summary: Event which is raised before selection change. Return false in order to cancel change. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. That can be null. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.items to obtain reference to array of new selected items. That can be null. Use ui.oldItems to obtain reference to array of old selected items. That can be null.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboClientEvents.SelectionChanged
member.summary: Event which is raised after selection change. Function takes arguments evt and ui. Use evt.originalEvent to obtain reference to event of browser. That can be null. Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igCombo. Use ui.items to obtain reference to array of new selected items. That can be null. Use ui.oldItems to obtain reference to array of old selected items. That can be null.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboDataSourceActionAttribute
member.summary: this is an attribute class which extends the mvc FilterAttribute. It should be put on top of the controller method that should return JSON (even though in the user code it will return Action Result). The idea of this filter is to transform the ActionResult into a JsonResult instance, taking into account filtering Request params. Since MVC doesn't have ViewState, we will need to infer all the features from the request itself, that's the only information we have regarding any previous state.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboDataSourceActionAttribute.OnActionExecuted(System.Web.Mvc.ActionExecutedContext)
member.summary: intercepts the controller call, and transforms the action result into a json result.

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboDataSourceActionAttribute.OnActionExecuting(System.Web.Mvc.ActionExecutingContext)
member.summary: implementation of the ActionExecuting event

member.name: M:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboDataSourceActionAttribute.BuildPredicate(System.Collections.Generic.List{Infragistics.Web.Mvc.FilterExpression})
member.summary: converts a list of filtering expressions into a LINQ predicate

member.summary: Sets custom attributes for main html element used by control

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DataSource
member.summary: Gets sets a valid data source accepted by $.ig.DataSource, or an instance of an $.ig.DataSource itself.

remarks.p: If it is set to string and "dataSourceType" option is not set, then $.ig.JSONPDataSource is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.SelectedIndexes
member.summary: Set gets indexes of selected items in list.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.SelectedValues
member.summary: Set gets selected items in list.

remarks.p: Note: If value is set, then SelectedIndexes is set to null.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.Width
member.summary: Gets sets width of combo.

remarks.p: The numeric and string values (valid html units for size) are supported. It includes %, px, em and other units.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.Height
member.summary: Gets sets height of combo.

remarks.p: The numeric and string values (valid html units for size) are supported. It includes %, px, em and other units.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DataSourceType
member.summary: Gets sets data source type (such as "json", "xml", etc). Please refer to the documentation of $.ig.DataSource and its type property.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DataSourceUrl
member.summary: Gets sets url which is used for sending JSON on request for remote filtering (MVC for example). That option is required when load on demand is enabled and its type is remote.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ResponseTotalRecCountKey
member.summary: Sets property in the response specifying the total number of records on the server.

remarks.p: see $.ig.DataSource. property in the response specifying the total number of records on the server.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ResponseDataKey
member.summary: Sets the name of record which holds the list of data rows in response-JSON object and when CompactData is disabled.

remarks.p: Default value is set to "Records". It means that rows of items should belong to the Records object.
For more information, consult documentation for javascript of $.ig.DataSource.
This is basically the property in the responses where data records are held, if the response is wrapped.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ResponseContentType
member.summary: Content type of the response.

remarks.p: See http://api.jquery.com/jQuery.ajax/ => contentType.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.RequestType
member.summary: Specifies the HTTP verb to be used to issue the request

remarks.p: Default value is set to 'GET'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ValueKey
member.summary: Gets sets name of column which contains the "value".

remarks.p: If it is missing, then name of first column will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.TextKey
member.summary: Gets sets name of column which contains the displayed text.

remarks.p: If it is missing, then "valueKey" option will be used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ItemTemplate
member.summary: Gets sets template used to render an item in list.

remarks.p:
Notes:
1. The jquery.tmpl.js of Microsoft is used and application should provide supported syntax for content. 2. Template is rendered inside of LI html element. So, application should consider restriction for layout: do not use "block" html elements and in case of absolutely positioned elements, they should not overlap with checkbox icons.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.HeaderTemplate
member.summary: Gets sets template used to render header in drop-down list.

remarks.p: The template is rendered inside of DIV html element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.FooterTemplate
member.summary: Gets sets template used to render footer in drop-down list.

remarks.p: The template is rendered inside of DIV html element.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.InputName
member.summary: Gets sets name of the hidden INPUT element, which is used when submiting data. Its value will be set to values of selected items valueKeys separated by "," character on any change in igCombo.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.NoMatchFoundText
member.summary: Gets sets text of list item for condition when "filteringType" option is enabled and no match was found. That is an override for the $.ig.Combo.locale.noMatchFoundText.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.PlaceHolder
member.summary: Gets sets value that is displayed when input field is empty. Default value is 'select...'.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ID
member.summary: Sets the ID of the Combo.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.UseExistingElement
member.summary: Sets the ID of the Combo.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.Format
member.summary: Gets or sets the format string that is used to format the text display values in the combo. Valid options are: "auto" (default) - uses automatic formatting for Date and number objects. "none", "", or null - will disable formatting Custom values can be something like "currency", "percent", "dateLong", "time", "MMM-dd-yyyy H:mm tt", etc. Custom format strings should match the data type in "textKey" column.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.FilterExprUrlKey
member.summary: Gets sets url key name that specifies how the remote filtering expressions will be encoded for remote requests, e.g. '&filter('col') = startsWith.' Default is OData

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DropDownButtonTitle

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.ClearButtonTitle
member.summary: Gets sets title for html element which represend clear button. That is an override for the $.ig.Combo.locale.clearButtonTitle.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DropDownAttachedToBody
member.summary: Gets sets ability to append container of drop-down list to the body or to the parent of combo.

remarks.p: Default value is 'true'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.Virtualization
member.summary: Gets sets ability to use virtual rendering for drop-down list. If that option is enabled, then only visible items are created and top edge of first visible item in list is aligned to the top edge of list.

remarks.p: Default value is 'false'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.CaseSensitive
member.summary: Gets sets whether filtering and auto selection should be case sensitive.

remarks.p: Default value is 'false'

member.summary: Gets sets whether the first matching item should be auto selected when typing in input.

remarks.p: Default value is 'true'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.CloseDropDownOnBlur
member.summary: Gets sets ability to close drop-down list when control loses focus.

remarks.p: Default value is 'true'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DropDownOnFocus
member.summary: Gets sets ability to show drop down list when combo gets focus. This option has effect only if mode is 'editable'

remarks.p: Default value is 'false'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.CloseDropDownOnSelect
member.summary: Gets sets ability to close drop down list when single item in the list is selected with mouse click or enter press. The default value when multi selection is enabled will be false. This option will not close the drop down when multiple selection is enabled and selection with ctrl or shift is performed.

remarks.p: Default value is 'true'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.SelectItemBySpaceKey
member.summary: Gets sets ability to select items by space button press

remarks.p: Default value is 'false'

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.CompactData
member.summary: Set option to pass to client only data with ValueKey and TextKey columns.

remarks.p: That property has effect only when DataSource is IQueryable

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.PreventSubmitOnEnter
member.summary: Gets sets ability to prevent form submitting on enter key press

remarks.p: Default value is 'true'
The keyboard will still show when the combo input is focused in editable mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.SuppressKeyboard
member.summary: Gets sets whether the onscreen keyboard should be shown when the dropdown button is clicked (touch devices only)

remarks.p: Default value is 'false'

json type="string" xml type="string" html type="string" script type="string" jsonp type="string" text type="string"

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.FilteringType
member.summary: Gets sets type of filtering.

remarks.p:
Notes:
If this option is set to "remote", then the "css.waitFiltering" is applied to combo and its drop-down list. remote type="string" filtering is performed by server. local type="string" filtering is performed by $.ig.DataSource. none type="string" filtering is disabled.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.FilteringCondition
member.summary: Gets sets condition used for filtering. type="contains|doesNotContain|startsWith|endsWith|greaterThan|lessThan|greaterThanOrEqualTo|lessThanOrEqualTo|equals|doesNotEqual

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.FilteringLogic
member.summary: Gets sets filtering logic. type="OR|AND"

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.Mode
member.summary: Sets gets functionality mode. editable type="string" Allows to modify value by edit field and drop-down list. dropdown type="string" Allows to modify value by drop-down list only. readonlylist type="string" Allows to open list, but does not allow any changes in field or selection in drop-down list. If selection is not set, then first item in dataSource is automatically selected. readonly type="string" Does not allow to open list or change value in field. If selection is not set, then first item in dataSource is automatically selected.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.HighlightMatchesMode
member.summary: Gets sets condition used for highlighting of matching parts in items of drop-down list. multi type="string" multiple matches in a single item are rendered. contains type="string" match at any position in item is rendered. startsWith type="string" only match which starts from the beginning of text is rendered. full type="string" only fully matched items are rendered. null type="object" matches are not rendered.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.DropDownOrientation
member.summary: Gets sets drop down opening orientation for the drop down list when open button is clicked. 'auto' type="string" Calculate orientation depending on combo position. 'top' type="string" Top orientation. 'bottom' type="string" Bottom orientation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.ComboModel.MultiSelectionSettings
member.summary: Gets sets object specifying multi selection feature options. The object has following properties enabled, addWithKeyModifier, showCheckboxes and itemSeparator. Set enabled to true to turn multi selection on. Set addWithKeyModifier to true to disable the additive selection, then additive selection can be done by ctrl + mouse click / enter. Set showCheckboxes to true to render check boxes in front of each drop down item. Use itemSeparator to set what string to be rendered between items in field. Note showCheckboxes and itemSeparator has effect only if multi selection is enabled.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogClientEvents
member.summary: Names of client events exposed by Dialog (igDialog widget)

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogClientEvents.StateChanging
member.summary:
Event which is raised before state of dialog was changed.
Return false in order to cancel action.
Function takes arguments "evt" and "ui".
Use evt to obtain browser event. That parameter can be null if state was modified from codes.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igDialog.
Use ui.button to obtain name of button, which triggered event. Note: if state was modified from codes, then "button" is undefined.
Use ui.oldState to obtain old state of dialog, which can be one of following: "opened", "minimized", "maximized", "closed".
Use ui.oldPinned to obtain boolean value of old pin state of dialog.
Use ui.action to obtain name of action. That can be one of the following:
"open" - request to open dialog
"close" - request to close dialog
"minimize" - request to minimize dialog
"maximize" - request to maximize dialog
"restore" - request to restore dialog from minimized or maximized state
"pin" - request to pin dialog
"unpin" - request to unpin dialog

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogClientEvents.StateChanged
member.summary:
Event which is raised after state of dialog was changed.
Function takes arguments "evt" and "ui".
Use evt to obtain browser event. That parameter can be null if state was modified from codes.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igDialog.
Use ui.button to obtain name of button, which triggered event. Note: if state was modified from codes, then "button" is undefined.
Use ui.oldState to obtain old state of dialog, which can be one of following: "opened", "minimized", "maximized", "closed".
Use ui.oldPinned to obtain boolean value of old pin state of dialog.
Use ui.action to obtain name of action. That can be one of the following:
"open" - dialog was opened. Note: event is raised before possible "openAnimation" started.
"close" - dialog was closed. Note: event is raised before possible "closeAnimation" started.
"minimize" - dialog was minimized
"maximize" - dialog was maximized
"restore" - dialog was restored from minimized or maximized state
"pin" - dialog was pinned
"unpin" - dialog was unpinned

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogClientEvents.AnimationEnded
member.summary:
Event which is raised after end animation when dialod was closed or opened.
Function takes arguments "evt" and "ui".
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igDialog.
Use ui.action to obtain name of action, which triggered animation.
"open" - dialog was opened
"close" - dialog was closed

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogClientEvents.Focus
member.summary:
Event which is raised when dialog or its content gets focus.
Function takes arguments "evt" and "ui".
Use evt to obtain browser event.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igDialog.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogClientEvents.Blur
member.summary:
Event which is raised when dialog or its content loses focus.
Function takes arguments "evt" and "ui".
Use evt to obtain browser event.
Use ui.owner to obtain reference to igDialog.

member.summary: Create DialogModel

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogModel.ID
member.summary:
Sets the ID of the dialog.
Note: that property has no effect if ContentJquerySelector or ContentID is set.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogModel.ContentJquerySelector
member.summary:
Sets the jquery selector which is used as content for the dialog.
Notes:
1. The content of dialog is built by $(value).
2. The ContentHTML and ContentID have priority over that property. 3. The ID property is not used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogModel.ContentID
member.summary:
Sets the ID of html element which is used as content for the dialog.
Notes:
1. The content of dialog is built by $("#" + value).
2. That property has priority over ContentJquerySelector.
3. The ContentHTML has priority over that property.
4. The ID property is not used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DialogModel.ContentHTML
member.summary:
Sets the HTML which is used as content for the dialog. Notes: 1. The content of dialog is built by $("
" + value + "
"). 2. That property has priority over possible ContentID and ContentJquerySelector. 3. The single quote character is not supported within html. The double quote should be used instead.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.DateDisplayFormat
member.summary: Sets custom date format used for display mode (no focus state).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.DateInputFormat
member.summary: Sets custom date format used for input/edit mode (focus state).

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.MinValue
member.summary: Sets minimum date which can be entered by user. Can be a DateTime, DateTimeOffset or a valid client date string/number representation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.MaxValue
member.summary: Sets maximum date which can be entered by user. Can be a DateTime, DateTimeOffset or a valid client date string/number representation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.DataMode
member.summary: Gets/Sets the value type returned by the get of value() method and option. Also affects how the value is stored for form submit.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.HideMaskOnFocus
member.summary: Hides or shows input mask when editor gets focus. True: hide input mask, false: show all input mask with prompts when editor gets focus.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.CenturyThreshold
member.summary: Sets year for auto detection of 20th and 21st centuries. That option is used to automatically fill century when the user entered only 1 or 2 digits into the year field or when the date pattern contains only 1 or 2 year positions, e.g. "yy" or "y". If user entered value larger than value of this option, then 20th century is used, otherwise the 21st.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.EnableUTCDates
member.summary: Enables/Disables serializing client date as UTC ISO 8061 string instead of using the local time and zone values. The option is only applied in "Date" .

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.DisplayTimeOffset
member.summary:
Sets time zone offset from UTC, in minutes. The client Date value is displayed with this offset instead of the local one.
Note: This option is best used when the actual value is UTC so the outcome is consistent. Values with ambiguous time zone could map to unpredictable times depending on the user agent local zone.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.UseLastGoodDate
member.summary: Set ability to use last valid date when user entered invalid value. Value of true allows automatically use last valid date, when editor loses focus and user failed to enter a valid date. In case of value false, the entered date is considered invalid and null is used.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.YearShift
member.summary: Sets difference between year in Gregorian calendar and displayed year.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.SpinDelta
member.summary: Sets delta-value which is used to increment or decrement value in editor on spin events. If value is set to negative value an exception is thrown. Non integer values are parsed to integer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.SpinDeltaObject
member.summary: Sets delta-values for each time period, which are used to increment or decrement the corresponding value in editor on spin events. If value is set to negative value an exception is thrown. Non integer values are parsed to integer.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorModel.LimitSpinToCurrentField
member.summary: Sets ability to modify only 1 date field on spin events. Value false enables changes of other date fields when incremented or decremented date-field reaches its limits. Value true modifies only value of one field.

member.name: T:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorDataMode
member.summary: Specifies the data mode of DateEditor and DatePicker widgets.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorDataMode.Date
member.summary:
The value method returns a Date object. When this mode is set the value sent to the server on submit is serialized as ISO 8061 string with local time and zone values by default. The EnableUTCDates option can be used to output a UTC ISO string instead.
For example 10:00 AM from a client with local offset of 5 hours ahead of GMT will be serialized as:
"2016-11-11T10:00:00+05:00"
Note: That is used as default.

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorDataMode.EditModeText
member.summary: The "text" in edit mode (focus) format (pattern) is used to be send to the server and is returned from the value() method (returns a string object).

member.name: F:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.DateEditorDataMode.DisplayModeText
member.summary: The "text" in display mode (no focus) format (pattern) is used to be send to the server and is returned from the value() method (returns a string object).

member.summary: Model used by MaskEditor.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.MaskEditorModel.Regional
member.summary: Sets gets custom regional settings for editor. Note: If it is string, then $.ig.regional[stringValue] is assumed and should be availble on the client.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.MaskEditorModel.InputMask
member.summary: Sets gets input mask. Mask may include filter-flags and literal characters.
member.remarks: Literal characters are part of mask which cannot be modified by end user. In order to use a filter-flag as a literal character, the escape "\\" character should be used. Default is "CCCCCCCCCC" Note: optional flags/entries affect the value returned by get of the "value" and "text" methods. List of filter-flags: C: any keyboard character. Entry is optional. &: any keyboard character. Entry is required. a: letter or digit character. Entry is optional. A: letter or digit character. Entry is required. ?: letter character. Entry is optional. L: letter character. Entry is required. 9: digit character. Entry is optional. 0: digit character. Entry is required. #: digit character or "+" or "_". Entry is optional with replacement by "emptyPositionChar" or by "padChar". >: all letters to the right are converted to the upper case. In order to disable conversion, the ">" flag should be used again. <: all letters to the right are converted to the lower case. In order to disable conversion, the "<" flag should be used again.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.MaskEditorModel.DataMode
member.summary: Sets data mode. That affects the get/set value method and paste operation.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.MaskEditorModel.UnfilledCharsPrompt
member.summary: Sets the character which is used as prompt in edit mode for available entry position. Default is the '_' char.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.MaskEditorModel.PadCharacter
member.summary: Sets the character which is used as replacement of not-filled required position in mask when editor is in display mode (not focused). Default is the '^' char.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.MaskEditorModel.EmptyCharacter
member.summary: Sets the character which is used as replacement of not-filled required position in mask when application calls get for the "value" or for the "text" methods. Default is the '*' char.

member.summary: Sets gets the character, which is used as negative sign. Note: This option has priority over possible regional settings.

member.summary: Sets the string, which is used as negative pattern. The "n" flag represents the value of number. The "-" and "()" flags are static part of pattern. Note: This option has priority over possible regional settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.MinValue
member.summary: Sets the minimum value which can be entered in editor by end user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.MaxValue
member.summary: Sets the maximum value which can be entered in editor by end user.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.MaxDecimals
member.summary: Sets the maximum number of decimal places which are used in display mode(no focus). Note: this option has priority over possible regional settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.MinDecimals
member.summary: Sets the minimum number of decimal places which are used in display (no focus) state. If number of digits in fractional part of number is less than the value of this option, then the "0" characters are used to fill missing digits. Note: this option has priority over possible regional settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.DataMode
member.summary: Sets type of value returned by the get of value() method. That also affects functionality of the set value(val) method and the copy/paste operations of browser.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.DecimalSeparator
member.summary: Sets the character, which is used as decimal separator. Note: this option has priority over possible regional settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.GroupSeparator
member.summary: Sets the character, which is used as separator for groups (like thousands). That option has effect only in display mode(no focus). Note: this option has priority over possible regional settings.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.ScientificFormat
member.summary: Sets support for E-power format in edit mode. If that option is set, then numeric value appears as a string with possible E-power flag. In edit mode the "E" or "e" character can be entered as well. Notes: The "+" character is not supported in edit mode.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.SpinDelta
member.summary: Sets delta-value which is used to increment or decrement value in editor on spin events. If value is set to negative value an exception is thrown. Non integer value is supported only for dataMode double and float.

member.name: P:Infragistics.Web.Mvc.NumericEditorModel.Groups
member.summary: Sets the number of digits in groups (separated by group/thousand separators). Note: this option has priority over possible regional settings.
